--- title: Managing and securing enterprise content at scale 300-level live demo description: Managing and securing enterprise content at scale 300-level live demo tabs: [ 'Demo preparation', 'Demo script'] --- export const Title = () => (

Managing and securing enterprise content at scale
300-level live demo

 ); ![Managing and securing banner](./images/Managing-and-Securing-300-Script-GitHub-banner-12-15-21.jpg) | DEMO OVERVIEW | | | :--- | :--- | | **Scenario overview** | This demo shows how Enterprise Content Management (FileNet ECM – IBM Content Navigator) capabilities in the IBM Cloud Pak for Business Automation facilitate collaboratively using documents. To illustrate this, a company’s hiring team collaborates during a hiring process. | | **Demo products** | Cloud Pak for Business Automation | | **Demo capabilities** | Document management | | **Sales guidance** | Download the sales guidance document here. | | **Demo intro slides** | Download the Introduction and Overview slides here. This is a short deck of customer-facing slides that sets the context for the demo. | | **Demo script** | A complete demo script is on the second tab above. You can download a printer-ready PDF of the demo script here.

This demo script has multiple tasks, that each have multiple steps. In each step, you have the details about what you need to do (**Actions**), what you can say while delivering this demo step (**Narration**), and what diagrams and screenshots you will see.

This demo script is a suggestion, and you are welcome to customize based on your sales opportunity. Most importantly, practice this demo in advance. If the demo seems easy for you to execute, the customer will focus on the content. If it seems difficult for you to execute, the customer will focus on your delivery. | | **Customer-ready
demo video** | View the demo video here. This is a short, but detailed, hands-on walkthrough of the scenario. The video is customer-ready.

Potential uses of this video are:

1. Familiarize yourself with the details of this scenario
2. Gain customer agreement that they would like to have a tech-seller do a deep-dive demo of this scenario
3. Use as a prospecting tool to generate customer interest in these capabilities | | **Customer-facing
expert guidance** | TBD | | **Required versions** | Cloud Pak for Business Automation V22.0.1 | | **How to get support** | **For IBMers:**
• Contact #itz-techzone-support or techzone.help@ibm.com regarding issues with reserving and provisioning Tech Zone environments.
• Contact #platinumdemos-automation-support regarding issues with setting up and running this demo.

**For Business Partners:**
• Contact Tech Zone Support regarding issues with reserving and provisioning Tech Zone environments.
• Contact Automation Platinum Demos Support regarding issues with setting up and running this demo. | ## **DEMO INSTALLATION AND SETUP**
1 - Provision a Cloud Pak for Business Automation environment
Install Cloud Pak for Business Automation **22.0.1** or provision a pre-installed ROKS environment. To reserve your pre-installed ROKS instance, follow these steps:
1. To reserve a preinstalled instance of Cloud Pak for Business Automation (CP4BA) V22.0.1 on Red Hat OpenShift, complete the form here. If you do not have a sales opportunity, select the purpose **Practice / Self-Education** to create a 3-day reservation (which can be extended to 8 days).
2. You will receive a confirmation email confirming the instance is provisioning.
3. You will receive a second email once the environment is provisioned. This email contains information, such as URLs, allowing you to connect to the instance.
If you have issues connecting to your instance, please contact TechZone support or refer to the installation documentation here.
4. The full installation of the Cloud Pak for Business Automation will take an additional 6-8 hours after you receive the second email (containing the environment access instructions).
Confirm the install is ready by validating the **icp4adeploy-cp4ba-access-info** ConfigMap has been created (this is final setup step for the CP4BA).
5. Select the **Cluster URL** from the second email.


6. Ensure you are on an **ITZ account**.


7. Ensure there are no **Alerts** for the cluster.


8. Click **OpenShift web console**.


9. Expand **Workloads** (1) and click **Config Maps** (2).


10. Select the **cp4ba** project.


If the ConfigMap does not appear after 8 hours, refer to the ROKS help site or contact Tech Zone Support.
For this demo you also need the **ADS-designer-access-info** ConfigMap to finish installing.
11. Type '**access**' (1) in the search field and click **icp4adeploy-cp4ba-access-info** (2).


12. Scroll down to **ADS-designer-access-info** in the **Data** section.


When the ADS designer access info is present in the data file, this indicates that the installation is complete and you are ready to proceed.

Please contact Tech Zone Support if you don’t see the access file info after 8 hours.
**[Go to top](#top)**
2 - Bookmark URLs
In this section you will create a cheat sheet collecting the links to the required CP4BA capabilities.
This demonstration uses two IBM content management products:
1. **IBM FileNet Content Manager**: IBM FileNet Content Manager offers enterprise-level scalability and flexibility to access and manage all forms of content and automate records management to help meet compliance needs. At the core of the platform are repository services for capturing, managing, and storing your business-related digital assets.
2. **IBM Content Navigator**: IBM Content Navigator is a web client that provides users with a console for working with content from multiple content servers. IBM Content Navigator also enables users to create custom views of the content on the web client by creating teamspaces, which provide a focused view of the relevant documents, folders, and searches that a team needs to complete their tasks.
Find more info about IBM FileNet Content Manager and IBM Content navigator here to access IBM Content Navigator and the IBM FileNet Content Manager engine administration console (ACCE).
Let’s collect the URLs and passwords required for your demo cheat sheet. Here is a sample copy of a complete cheat sheet (at the end of Step 2):


IBM Content Navigator, Content Platform Engine administration (ACCE), and Business Automation Studio all use the same username and password in the demo. The demo refers to this as the cp4admin user.

Cp4admin user credentials:
Username: cp4admin
Password: unique to each instance. The directions below show where to find the password.
1. Click **Workloads** to expand the menu.


2. Select **ConfigMaps**.


3. Type **'access'** in the search field (the results will automatically filter).


4. Click the **icpdeploy-cp4ba-access-info** ConfigMap.


Scroll to **navigator-access-info**. Bookmark the **Business Automation Navigator for CP4BA** URL and copy to your cheat sheet. This URL opens IBM Content Navigator during the demo and demo prep.
Copy the password to your cheat sheet – this is the ‘cp4admin’ user password for the demo.

5. Scroll to **cpe-access-info** in the data section.


6. Bookmark the **Content Platform Engine administration** (ACCE) URL and copy to your cheat sheet.



7. Scroll to **bastudio-access-info**. Bookmark the **Cloudpak Dashboard** URL. This URL opens Business Automation Studio during the demo and demo prep.


**[Go to top](#top)**
3 - Create users
The demo uses three personas: Henry (the HR Manager), Debby (the hiring Manager), and Patrick (the payroll Manager). Let’s configure the individual accounts for Henry, Debby, and Patrick in the CP4BA Instance.
Start by creating their logins in the Content Platform Engine (ACCE) LDAP.
1. Select **Secrets**.


2. Type '**openldap**' (1) in the search field and click **cp4adeploy-openldap-customldif** (2).


3. Click **Actions** (1) and then select **Edit Secret** (2).


Let’s update the '**ldapfile_user.ldif file**.'

4. In order to see all the information at once, update the file in a separate text editor (e.g., Microsoft Word).

Copy the existing text in the **Value** field to your text editor.


5. Copy the user data below for Henry, Debby, and Patrick. Find the user name **rrServiceUser** (1) and **paste** their user data after it (2).
dn: uid=henry,dc=example,dc=org
uid: henry
cn: henry
sn: henry
userpassword: henry2022
objectClass: top
objectClass: posixAccount
objectClass: organizationalPerson
objectClass: inetOrgPerson
objectClass: person
uidNumber: #####+1
gidNumber: XXXXXX
homeDirectory: /home/henry/
mail: henry@example.org

dn: uid=debby,dc=example,dc=org
uid: debby
cn: debby
sn: debby
userpassword: debby2022
objectClass: top
objectClass: posixAccount
objectClass: organizationalPerson
objectClass: inetOrgPerson
objectClass: person
uidNumber: #####+2
gidNumber: XXXXXX
homeDirectory: /home/debby/
mail: rrServiceUser@example.org

dn: uid=patrick,dc=example,dc=org
uid: patrick
cn: patrick
sn: patrick
userpassword: patrick2022
objectClass: top
objectClass: posixAccount
objectClass: organizationalPerson
objectClass: inetOrgPerson
objectClass: person
uidNumber: #####+3
gidNumber: XXXXXX
homeDirectory: /home/patrick/
mail: patrick@example.org


6. Copy the user password for uids henry, debby, and Patrick to your cheat sheet.
7. Copy the **gidNumber** (1) and the **uidNumber** (2) from the **rrServiceUser**.


8. Replace **XXXXXX** in the **gidNumber field** in **henry**'s user data with the gidNumber from the rrServiceuser. Repeat for debby and patrick.


9. Assign a new **uidNmber** for henry, debby, and patrick by starting with the **uidNumber** for **rrServiceUser** and adding 1 for each sequentially.

For example, if rrServiceUser uidNumber: 14583116, then **henry**’s uidNumber is 14583117, **debby**’s uidNumber is 14583118, and **patrick**’s uidNumber is 14583119.

The final new users should look like the below:


10. Copy and past the following text at the end of the **GeneralUsers** list:

member: uid=henry,dc=example,dc=org
member: uid=debby,dc=example,dc=org
member: uid=patrick,dc=example,dc=org


11. Copy and past the following text at the end of the **TaskUsers** list (at the end of the file):

member: uid=henry,dc=example,dc=org
member: uid=debby,dc=example,dc=org
member: uid=patrick,dc=example,dc=org


12. Copy all the text from your editor and replace the text in the **Value** (1) field. Click **Save** (2).


13. Click **Reveal values**.


14. Verify your updates were saved.


15. Now restart the LDAP pod to implement the updates. Start by clicking **Pods**.


16. Type '**openldap**' in the search field.


17. When the results display, click the **menu** icon (1) in the row containing '**icp4adeploy-openldap-deploy-XXXXX-XXX**' (the numbers at the end will vary). Select **Delete Pod** (2).


18. Click **Delete**.


19. A new pod will automatically re-create.


Focus Corp’s Cloud Pak administrator configures the access rights for users, including henry, debby and patrick. Let’s find the Cloud Pak administator password, log into ACCE, and make the access changes necessary for the demo.
20. Click **Secrets**.


21. Click the down arrow next to **Project: cp4ba** (1). Select **ibm-common-services** (2).


22. Type '**auth-idp**' in the search field (1) and click **platform-auth-idp-credentials** (2).


23. Click **Reveal values**.


24. Copy the **admin_password** and **admin_username** to your cheat sheet.

These logins are not the same as the 'cp4admin' credentials copied for CP4BA capabilities earlier in Step 2.

Let’s add henry, debby, and patrick to the CP4A user administration panel.

25. Open Business Automation Studio and sign in using the URL from your cheat sheet, **Username: 'admin'** and the **password** (1) from the previous step. Click **Log in** (2).


26. Click the **menu** icon in the top right corner of the page.


27. Select **IBM Automation (cp4ba)**.


28. Click **Manage users**.


29. Click **Add users +**.


30. Type '**henry**' in the search field (1) and click **henry** in the results list (2).


31. Add '**debby**' and '**patrick**' by repeating the prior step.

32. Verify **henry**, **debby** and **patrick** are added (1). Click **Next** (2).


33. Select **Assign roles directly** (1). Click **Next** (2).


34. Select the box next to **Automation Administrator** and **Automation Developer** (1). Click **Next** (2).


35. Click **Add**.


36. Verify **henry**, **debby**, and **patrick** are added.


37. **Log out** from Business Automation Studio.

Let's add Henry as an Administrator in IBM Navigator so he can show role-based redactions during the demo.

38. Open IBM Navigator and sign in using the URL, **Username 'cp4admin'** and **Password** (1) from your cheat sheet. Click **Log in** (2).


39. Click the **hamburger** menu at the top left of the page.


40. Click **Administration**.


41. Click **Settings**.


42. Click the **Administrators** tab.


43. Type '**henry**' (1) in the **New Administrator** field. Click **Add** (2).


44. Click **Save and Close**.


45. Hover your mouse over the **user** icon (1) and click **Log Out** (2).


46. Sign in using the **Username: henry** and **Password**: henry2022 (1). Click **Log in** (2). This is the password for henry that you copied to your cheat sheet earlier in Step 3 – Create users, number 6.


47. Click the **hamburger** icon at the top left of the page.


48. Make sure **Administration** menu displays as an option for **henry** to select.


If **Administration** does not appear, go back to number 25 in the step 3- Create users and repeat the steps.
**[Go to top](#top)**
